results.title: From Latvia to Beechworth : personal journeys
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: Beate and Marta immigrated to Australia with their families, changing their lives for ever. Leaving behind their native Latvia both women struggled with acceptance, a new language, new customs and a foreign environment. This film showcases the strength, humour and humanity needed to survive and to flourish in a new land. Inga, her mother Beate and their friend Marta reflect on their lives and traditions, old and new.

results.title: Crafts in Yackandandah
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: Inspired by the changing landscape, the availability of raw materials and a sense of community, various talented crafts practitioners call Yackandandah home. From internationally recognised potter John Dermer and local weaver Jan Clements, to Christine Thorpe owner of Spiritus Gallery we are introduced to wood carvers, guitar makers and jewellery designers.

results.title: Brendan Smith : making a difference in Rutherglen
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: A self proclaimed ‘Average Joe’, Brendan Smith offers his insatiable enthusiasm and passion for all things audio visual, installing professional standard lighting and sound equipment in Rutherglen’s local hall, making it possible for everyone in the community to connect with the arts.

results.title: The Natimuk Rock Climbers
results.brief_description: Louise Shepherd and Keith ‘Noddy’ Lockwood reminisce, tell anecdotes and reveal what makes a “mountain goat” tick, and how Mt Arapiles, in western Victoria, has shaped Natimuk’s destiny as an international destination for climbers.
results.description: Louise Shepherd and Keith ‘Noddy’ Lockwood reminisce, tell anecdotes and reveal what makes a “mountain goat” tick, and how Mt Arapiles, in western Victoria, has shaped Natimuk’s destiny as an international destination for climbers.

results.title: An Olive Grove in Laharum
results.brief_description: Toscana Olive Plantation and Laharum Grove, in western Victoria, both operate from the same original plantation of olives, working together to ensure the freshness, quality and flavour of their oil. While they acknowledge Laharum is a peaceful place to live, the workers at these olive farms are hectic, determined to produce some of the best quality olive oil in Victoria.

results.title: Clarrie's Ranch
results.creator_credit: Jessica Scott, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Clarence ‘Clarrie’ Mackley has built his own patch of paradise, a small ranch devoted to Slim Dusty, Elvis and all things country and western. Living by his ethos of ‘do what you wanna do’, Mackley attracts tourists from all over to the world to his colourful place in Horsham, western Victoria.

results.title: At the Foot of the Arapiles
results.brief_description: Meet the business owners and locals who call Natimuk home and wouldn’t want to live anywhere else. Even though locals consider it to be full of ‘climbers’ and ‘arty-types’, they recognise Natimuk, in western Victoria, as an active and diverse community and wouldn’t have it any other way.

results.title: Gil and Liz Hopkins
results.brief_description: Gil and Liz Hopkins have lived in Laharum, in western Victoria, for over 30 years. They raised three children there, built their own home, which is nearly completely self-sufficient, with solar panels and reclaimed water. Their hope is to leave the land in better shape than they found it and they’re taking their knowledge to the community to help others do the same.

results.title: Horsham Greyhounds
results.brief_description: Meet the people that work at the greyhound races every Tuesday afternoon at Horsham, in western Victoria. Mostly volunteers, they assist the dogs and their owners from vets checks to wash downs, ensuring that Horsham Greyhounds remains the safest race in Victoria.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Horsham Shire
results.brief_description: Down Victoria’s Western Freeway, to the north of the Grampians, lie three towns that help to make up Horsham Shire. The towns of Horsham, Natimuk and Laharum are all from the same region, but, in meeting the locals, we get to see what truly makes these unique towns tick and why the locals wouldn’t want to live anywhere else.
